title: Distributive Law
text: Using distributive law for LHS numerator, $${\left(2x-6\right)}^2=2^2 {\left(x-3\right)}^2$$

title: Conversion
text: Convert radicals to exponents for LHS denominator using the fact that $$\sqrt[n]{y}=y^{\frac{1}{n}}$$, so $$\sqrt[3]{x-3}={\left(x-3\right)}^{\frac{1}{3}}$$
speech: Convert radicals to exponents for LHS denominator using the fact that  the n-th root of y is equal to y raised to the 1 over n, power , so , the cube root of x minus 3 end root is equal to parentheses x minus 3,  raised to the 1 third power

title: LHS
text: We have $$\frac{2^2 {\left(x-3\right)}^2}{{\left(x-3\right)}^{\frac{1}{3}}}$$, which is equivalent to $$2^2 \frac{{\left(x-3\right)}^2}{{\left(x-3\right)}^{\frac{1}{3}}}$$.
speech: We have  fraction, 2 squared times, parentheses x minus 3,  squared, over, parentheses x minus 3,  raised to the 1 third power  , which is equivalent to  2 squared fraction, parentheses x minus 3,  squared, over, parentheses x minus 3,  raised to the 1 third power  .

title: Simplification
text: We have $$2^2 {\left(x-3\right)}^{\frac{5}{3}}=2^{12}$$. Divide both sides by $$2^2$$, we get $${\left(x-3\right)}^{\frac{5}{3}}=2^{10}$$
speech: We have  2 squared times parentheses x minus 3,  raised to the 5 thirds power is equal to 2 to the twelfth . Divide both sides by  2 squared , we get  parentheses x minus 3,  raised to the 5 thirds power is equal to 2 to the tenth

. Divide both sides by   2 squared
, we get    x minus 3,  raised to the 5 thirds power is equal to 2 to the tenth

title: Simplification
text: To transform $${\left(x-3\right)}^{\frac{5}{3}}$$ to $$x-3$$, we can raise both sides of the equation to the power of $$\frac{3}{5}$$ to get $${\left({\left(x-3\right)}^{\frac{5}{3}}\right)}^{\frac{3}{5}}={\left(2^{10}\right)}^{\frac{3}{5}}$$, which can be simplified to $$(x-3)=2^6$$.
speech: To transform  parentheses x minus 3,  raised to the 5 thirds power  to  x minus 3 , we can raise both sides of the equation to the power of  3 fifths  to get  parentheses parentheses x minus 3,  raised to the 5 thirds power  raised to the 3 fifths power is equal to parentheses 2 to the tenth  raised to the 3 fifths power , which can be simplified to , parentheses x minus 3,  is equal to 2 to the sixth .

to   x minus 3
, we can raise both sides of the equation to the power of   3 fifths
to get     x minus 3,  raised to the 5 thirds power  raised to the 3 fifths power is equal to  2 to the tenth  raised to the 3 fifths power
, which can be simplified to  ,  x minus 3,  is equal to 2 to the sixth

title: Simplification
text: Since $${\left(a^b\right)}^c=a^{b c}$$, $${\left({\left(x-3\right)}^{\frac{5}{3}}\right)}^{\frac{3}{5}}=\frac{{\left(2^{10}\right)}^3}{5}$$ can be simplified to $$(x-3)=2^6$$.
